Issues.Title: vue-server-renderer: CSS variables get lost in dynamic style attributes
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [github.com](https://github.com/fieteboerner/broken-vue-server-renderer-demo) ### Steps to reproduce 1. git clone https://github.com/fieteboerner/broken-vue-server-renderer-demo 2. cd broken-vue-server-renderer-demo 3. npm install 4. node index.js ### What is expected? The SSR `node index.js` command should print the exact same output as the [vue renderer in the browser](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#) ```
Hello World
``` ### What is actually happening? ```
Hello World
``` The Variable with the integer value ist missing, and the lowerCamelCase Variables are converted to kebap-cased variables. This breaks the UX of our application because the content is jumping since the missing/malformed Variables are not matching the ones in the actual CSS. After rehydration in the Browser, the correct style-Attributes get rendered, and our Styles take effect. --- ### Sidenote in version 2.5.0 the variable with the numeric value does not get lost. This is the output from version 2.5.0: ```
Hello World
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "vue-server-renderer: CSS variables get lost in dynamic style attributes" (#12374)

Issues.Title: Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is diffrerent
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [github.com/vuejs/vue/tree/2.6](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/tree/2.6) ### Steps to reproduce Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is Differenct. I Use This test code to Test ```HTML Document
``` if i use /2.6.9/vue.js the devetools isn't print 2323,but if i use /2.6.9/vue.min.js it print 2323 but in 3.x version,the action is same,not print 2323 ### What is expected? Make them behave the same ### What is actually happening? In 2.6.9 Dev version Microsoft Edge 96 Developtools not print log 2323 Product version Microsft Edge 96 Developtools print log 2323 In 3.x Them same not print log 2323
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is diffrerent" (#12373)

Issues.Title: Remove lodash as a dependency
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Those guys don't take security seriously. See for example CVE-2021-41720


- They dispute the issue (questionable, but OK)
- The don't want to fix it (OK)
- There are removing all issues when people asking for clearance. Not closing it, but hiding it. Not OK!
- See CVE-2021-41720 Has been Rejected lodash/lodash#5325, https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/5294 and https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/5296

Not an API request

Issues.Title: Scoped HTML
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve? Allows you to create a scoped block of HTML without having to create a component (similar to petite-vue). This has already been mentioned [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/12212). However after searching for the issue/PR for hours I still cannot find it. Please could you either keep this issue, re-open the original issue or add a comment which atleast links to the issue/pr. ### What does the proposed API look like? ```
{{ count }}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scoped HTML" (#12370)

Issues.Title: Non-string 'value' prop is stringified on custom element
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/gallant-feather-wxyot?file=/src/my-element.js)







### Steps to reproduce
View the codesandbox render result

### What is expected?
The custom element render the json content

### What is actually happening?
The custom element render "[object Object]"

---
Accorading to source code:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/0603ff695d2f41286239298210113cbe2b209e28/src/platforms/web/runtime/modules/dom-props.js#L49
, any prop name 'value' on dom element will be stringified, but when using custom elements, the 'value' prop may be an object or number and it should not be stringified.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Non-string 'value' prop is stringified on custom element" (#12369)

Issues.Title: Open a Vue for the elderly, called Older people or old-Vue.js
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Around the world, screens dazzle the elderly, optimize services for the elderly and improve their quality.
Not only that, it can also make wechat and short video more focused on the elderly
可以解决中国(China)老人使用手机，对于手机屏幕不太娴熟，看的眼花缭乱，需要字体放大，更好的排版。
对于微信(WeChat)、快手、抖音、QQ、都建议引用 Old People Vue

### What does the proposed API look like?
Open a new library or one more class to redesign the typesetting of the exclusive elderly. I especially recommend such a humanized design, because serving the elderly has won more social attention, so that more people fall in love with Vue, and it has changed from three words to four, and the fourth is called "love"
新开一个库，或者多一个类，重新设计专属老人的排版。我特别推荐这样人性化的设计，因为服务老人赢得更多社会的关注，从而更多人爱上Vue，还有让它 从 三个词语变成四个，第四个叫做"关爱"

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Open a Vue for the elderly, called Older people or old-Vue.js" (#12368)

Issues.Title: 想通过babel修改template编译后的render函数
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/wulinsheng123/vue/blob/main/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
https://github.com/wulinsheng123/vue/blob/main/src/App.vue

### What is expected?
能获取render函数，并且能修改render函数

### What is actually happening?
通过webpack能获取到render函数，但是修改不了render函数

---
公司内部有2个ui框架elementUI和Ivivew，现在希望通过编译将elementUI转义为Iview UI框架。现在想法是通过拦截到render函数，然后通过babel编译，将ELementUI 转为IviewUI。只能通过webpack hook去拦截vue的render函数，但是vue生产的render时间比较特别，我想修改这个render就会报错
之前已经留言给了webpack，但是webpack觉得应该问vue-开发 ,
webpack/webpack-sources#141

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Memory leak ??
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Browser

MacOS, Chrome 96.0.4664.45

### Reproduction link
https://jsfiddle.net/ToBeBest/n4gtcpea/

### Steps to reproduce

1. Click the `Sign` button
2. Chrome DevTools - Memory - Take heap snapshot (Select JavaScript VM instance:  fiddle.jshell.net)
3. Filter by `Detached HTMLButtonElement`
4. Now you can see the detached button as below

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4537336/141889676-6647bc51-ada0-4f88-957b-5e8fa0a52186.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4537336/141889624-ddf1a2ef-4f82-4843-b515-d7225fa0182b.png)


### What is expected?
Vue should release the button

### What is actually happening?
The button shows in `Detached HTMLButtonElement`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Memory leak ??" (#12358)

Issues.Title: add `deep` style attribute, or other way to support inherited styles
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It's hard to create clean components and styles when you've got basically just `scoped` or completely global, without any middle ground. 

We recently created some complex, nested components for a shared-state multiplayer game interface. We abstracted it in a way that would enable us to keep the complicated functionality in reusable components, while the style of the UI and the contents of cards could be customized from a higher level view component. We were able to support the data and functionality of this pretty easily with slots and slotProps. But when it came time to style things, it got a lot harder. 

Another use case I've run into in the past was redesigning an existing app that had global CSS files set in `main.js`. I wanted to be able to work on my new pages and components in the same codebase, without having to worry about inheritance issues with the old styles and without breaking every other page. So I tried to figure out how I could take the CSS files out of main, and include them on the highest level component of the old app, so I could create a new high level component with different CSS files, or just scoped styles in each component. I was pretty new to Vue at the time, but I couldn't find a way to do this. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
For both of my use cases, a `deep` attribute on the style tag in single-file components would have addressed this. It could behave exactly like the `:deep` and `:slotted` selectors work in CSS, except this would enable both style blocks and external stylesheets to have their scope defined and it would be a cleaner way to set these styles because there would be less issues with CSS preprocessors struggling with custom selectors.

```html
<style lang="scss" scoped></style>
<style lang="scss" deep></style>
<style lang="scss" slotted></style>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "add `deep` style attribute, or other way to support inherited styles" (#12353)

Issues.Title: Style conflicts caused by using v-if and custom directives at the same time
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.2

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/hopeful-roentgen-rp1x3)







### Steps to reproduce
1. click the white button
2. v-wide will change the backgroundColor

### What is expected?
The second popup's backgroundColor should be blue

### What is actually happening?
The popup's backgroundColor is red that is the previous one

---
I use v-if and a custom directives to update the inline style at the same time. when the next element is displayed, it will inherit the style of the previous one. And the displayed element doesn't trigger the inserted lifecycle.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Style conflicts caused by using v-if and custom directives at the same time" (#12352)

Issues.Title: qtwebengine click event not working
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codepen.io](https://codepen.io/damaowife/pen/wvqyXrW)







### Steps to reproduce
1.qtwebengine (navigator.userAgent :Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) QtWebEngine/5.6.3 Chrome/49.0.2623.111 Safari/537.36)
2.vue version (2.6.14)
3. someTimes click event not working (Open QT for a long time.)

### What is expected?
work fine

### What is actually happening?
When click event not working, we found something:
at "vue/src/platforms/web/runtime/modules/events.js" lines 70: `e.timeStamp >= attachedTimestamp` is false

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Routes with same path don't register
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

```js
const routes = [
  {
    path: `/logout`,
    name: `login page`,
    component: Home, // () => import(`../views/Login.vue`),
  },
  {
    path: `/login`,
    name: `login page`,
    component: () => import(`../views/Login.vue`),
  },
]
```

`/logout` doesn't work (fall backs to 404) but when removing the second path in the route (/login) `/logout ` works

I can provide a reproducible example if necessary 

Please make vue router warn about routes with same names
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Routes with same path don't register" (#3675)

Issues.Title: Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/safari-scrollbehavior-gh2fx)







### Steps to reproduce
Click on the router-link in safari.

### What is expected?
Smooth scrolling

### What is actually happening?
Scroll quickly to an element

---
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/cb4c16398bf25aaa2c5d755faa480ad1e81cd756/src/util/scroll.js#L164

This line returns `false`. I'm using a safari [polyfill](https://github.com/iamdustan/smoothscroll) that enables smooth scrolling with `window.scrollTo`, but smooth scrolling doesn't work because `vue-router` uses a different interface with two arguments.

`window.scrollTo(x, y)` instead of `window.scrollTo({ top, left })`

An even more interesting situation arises when you execute code in the browser console: `Object.keys(document.documentElement.style).includes('scrollBehavior')`

This code will return `true`, because the `scrollBehavior` key is present in the object.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists" (#3674)

The banner is closable and opens Vue School's Cyber Monday promo page in a new tab. The banner will not reappear if a user has closed it (stored in local storage).

Issues.Title: Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/cb4c16398bf25aaa2c5d755faa480ad1e81cd756/src/util/scroll.js#L164

This line returns false. I'm using a safari [polyfill](https://github.com/iamdustan/smoothscroll) that enables smooth scrolling with `window.scrollTo`, but smooth scrolling doesn't work because vue-router uses a different interface with two arguments.

`window.scrollTo(x, y)` instead of `window.scrollTo({ top, left })`

An even more interesting situation arises when you execute code in the browser console: `Object.keys(document.documentElement.style).includes('scrollBehavior')`

This code will return true, because the scrollBehavior key is present in the object.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists" (#3673)

Issues.Title: router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.12

### Reproduction link
[stackblitz.com](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vite-82dmj6?devtoolsheight=33&file=src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Create vue router add a route to it
Add it to Vue 
Navigate to said page, the value of the currentRoute is correctly set
Make any change to the componenet where currentRoute.value is called, save
The page will reload with Vite HMR
Value of the currentRoute is set to the homepage

### What is expected?
The currentRoute should still be equal to the route we are currently on

### What is actually happening?
The currentRoute value isn't properly set

---
Thought it had to do with params at first since it was the only time i was using currentRoute.value.params.xxx but it seems to affect every page.

I made a gif showing to situation for clarification : 

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26070848/143688237-5d116194-dd32-43ec-a98e-9cb992ad516c.gif)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated" (#3671)

What is expected?
The currentRoute should still be equal to the route we are currently on

What is actually happening?

Thought it had to do with params at first since it was the only time i was using currentRoute.value.params.xxx but it seems to affect every page.

Issues.Title: Delayed start for fetching routes data
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Some apps does not know routes structure in a compile time, but have to fetch some data in a run time. My use-case is content app which have to download content from CMS and then generate routes.

But currently in a meantime it reports "[Vue Router warn]: No match found for location with path". After routes loaded I have to call this.$router.replace(this.$route.fullPath).

### What does the proposed API look like?
Option like start: false in createRouter.
Method like router.start().

Or just document how to solve it by current API. There are [some workarounds](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1377#issuecomment-368498552), but they feels like a hacking.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Delayed start for fetching routes data" (#3668)

Issues.Title: Docs: Update Vue School Black Friday banner
Issues.Body:
This PR updates the Black Friday Vue School banner, adding a subtle animation to the background coins.

When the cursor is over the banner, the coins move from left to right or right to left, according to the mouse X position when is over the banner. This uses CSS transforms.

This is implemented only for desktop (1024px and wider resolutions). Tablet and mobile viewports have no animation and stay unmodified.

You can check the [video preview here](https://imgur.com/a/sfhkUkv).

Related to PR [3664](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/pull/3664)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Docs: Update Vue School Black Friday banner" (#3665)

Issues.Title: next in beforeEach is useless when we call addRoute in beforeEach
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/eloquent-elgamal-zdwdq?file=/src/router/index.js)







### Steps to reproduce
At the first, you are in `/route1`, you can click 'home', '/route2', '/route1', that's all ok. 
But the first time you click '/route3', you can not see it. You must click '/route3' the second time, it will show.

### What is expected?
The first time we click `/route3`, it will show.

### What is actually happening?
route3 didn't show at the first time it been clicked.

---
Why do we transitionTo START after we addRoute? https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/index.js#L257-L259

It seems there is a bug. When we call addRoute in beforeEach, next will be useless.

When we navigation to a route, router.history.pending = route (https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L139) . Then we call addRoute, and addRoute calls trnasitionTo, it will change the pending to currentLocation, so we call next will be ignored (https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L192-L194).

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "next in beforeEach is useless when we call addRoute in beforeEach" (#3660)

Issues.Title: case-insensitive on isActive property
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[localhost/active-links/abouT](http://localhost:8080/active-links/abouT)







### Steps to reproduce
- Run `yarn run dev` in the root path of the project
- Go to http://localhost:8080/active-links/abouT


### What is expected?
The "/about" will be treated as active.

### What is actually happening?
The "/about" is not treated as active.

---
Since Vue Router already supports case-insensitive matching for routes themselves. I think it should be the same for the active match to be case-insensitive too.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: fix: clean more than two consecutive slashes
Issues.Body:
**Issue**:
Currently a path beginning with three slashes (`///`) will in fact potentially redirect to another domain. This is because the `cleanPath` utility only replaces two slashes, leaving two behind.

**Reproduction**:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/vue-router-3-redirect

This PR simply replaces consecutive slashes with a single slash.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix: clean more than two consecutive slashes" (#3652)

Issues.Title: Access globalProperties in store
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
We should be able to access the globalProperties or the Vue instance in the store.

For exemple, I add a custom axios to my globalProperties `app.config.globalProperties.$axios = axios`. In a mutation, I want to get some values by calling my custom axios defined in globalProperties and add them in a state. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
In vuex 3, used to have _vm in the store, so why not do something similar ?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve
Issues.Body:
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

Fixes #2083
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve" (#2084)

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/embed/optimistic-pine-hqsbc?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark)







### Steps to reproduce
The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

### What is expected?
The value is to be set correctly.

### What is actually happening?
Throws a error. 

[Vue warn]: Error in v-on handler: "TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'user')"

---
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

I need the value to be preserved due to the vuex-persistedstate that I'm using and I don't want to get overridden, but at the same time if no state is to be preserved the module default state should be defined.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve" (#2083)

Issues.Title: feat: add named export in cjs format file
Issues.Body:
`export default` has many bugs when mixed with `commonjs`, `vuex` use export default object in `vuex.cjs.js` which  behavior is not like `vue-router-next`. It cause the below code cannot get correct value in the lastest vite version

```js
import { createStore } from 'vuex'
console.log(createStore === undefined)
```

Issues.Title: feat: add named export in cjs format file
Issues.Body:
`export default` has many bugs when used with `commonjs`, `vuex` use export default object in `vuex.cjs.js` which is not like `vue-router-next`. It cause the below code cannot get correct value in the lastest vite version

```js
import { createStore } from 'vuex'
console.log(createStore === undefined)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat: add named export in cjs format file" (#2080)

Issues.Title: vue__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__.reactive) is not a function
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2


### Steps to reproduce
Trying to upgrade vue 2 to vue 3 with vuex 4 version and getting below error

vuex.esm-bundler.js?16b2:140 Uncaught TypeError: (0 , vue__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__.reactive) is not a function




### What is actually happening?
Trying to upgrade vue 2 to vue 3 with vuex 4 version using migration build.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Unable to use module mutations or actions
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vuex

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

I'm recently facing some troubles while using Vuex. 
I have two modules: user and categories.

I use the following code to register the two modules in the store/index.js file. 

    import Vue from 'vue'
    import Vuex from 'vuex'
    
    import categories from "./categories"
    import user from './user'
    console.log(categories)
    
    Vue.use(Vuex)
    
    export default new Vuex.Store({
      modules: {
        user: user,
        categories: categories,
      }
    })



After execution, I am able to find states in both modules in the path ```$store.state.moduleName.moduleStates```. However, I am unable to find mutations nor actions.

I first tried to set namespace to false, the mutations and actions were not registered as global mutations and actions. (There are no such mutations or actions at all)

I then tried to set namespace to true, the mutations and actions were not registered as namespaced mutations and actions neither. (```this.$store.commit('moduleName/mutationName')``` doesn't work; an error message pops up: ```[vuex] unknown action type: categories/getAllCategories```)

I tried to debug by printing out the 'categories' module object and the store object and I found that:

 1. Modules themselves are correctly defined. Mutations and Actions are correctly defined in the module object.
 2. Module states are correctly registered in store.state (as per previously tested)
 3. Module mutations and actions are not correctly registered in ```store._mutations``` and ```store._actions``` (no matter the modules are namespaced or not, the mutations and actions don't appear as global or namespaced properties); ```store._mutations``` and ```store._actions``` show as empty objects. 
 4. Modules can be seen in ```store._modules.root._children``` and ```store._modules.root._rawModule```

The result of console.log(categories) and console.log(this.$store) are shown: 
[![console.log(categories)][1]][1]

------

[![console.log(this.$store)][2]][2]


Can someone help me to solve the issue?


  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/8cdba.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/qeSjU.png
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to use module mutations or actions" (#2077)

Issues.Title: Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index'
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
- In a nodejs app open app.js with VSCode and type "import create"
- Select "createStore / node_modules/vuex/types/index" and press enter
- Results in "import { createStore } from 'node_modules/vuex/types/index';"
- Execute "npm run watch"
- Fails with "Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index' in '/var/www/vhosts/yourwebsite/httpdocs/resources/js'"
- Change "import { createStore } from 'node_modules/vuex/types/index';" to "import { createStore } from 'vuex';"
- "npm run watch" now works BUT autocompletion for the "store" is no longer available

### What is expected?
"npm run watch" should work simultaneous with autocompletion

### What is actually happening?
"npm run watch" works or autocompletion works, not both

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index'" (#2076)

Issues.Title: DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json.
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1456/commits/93359b729275672a56c11aa41c20129e9158b36a)
I used a PR that solved the [same exact issue](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1455) in postcss.







### Steps to reproduce
Environments:
node v16.11.1
npm v8.0.0
@vue/cli 4.5.13

Vue 3 project (v3.2.20)

Steps:
1) Run "vue ui"

### What is expected?
No warnings

### What is actually happening?
This warning:

(node:19450) [DEP0148] DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json.
Update this package.json to use a subpath pattern like "./*".
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)

---
This is likely caused by new deprecation warnings introduced in node 16.

It was already fixed in postcss by updating the deprecated folder mapping to use a subpath pattern.
See this PR:
https://github.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1456/commits/93359b729275672a56c11aa41c20129e9158b36a

All they did was replace this line
"./": "./"

with this
"./*": "./*"

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json." (#2071)

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump url-parse from 1.5.1 to 1.5.3
Issues.Body:
Bumps [url-parse](https://github.com/unshiftio/url-parse) from 1.5.1 to 1.5.3.
Commits
  • ad44493 [dist] 1.5.3
  • c798461 [fix] Fix host parsing for file URLs (#210)
  • 201034b [dist] 1.5.2
  • 2d9ac2c [fix] Sanitize only special URLs (#209)
  • fb128af [fix] Use 'null' as origin for non special URLs
  • fed6d9e [fix] Add a leading slash only if the URL is special
  • 94872e7 [fix] Do not incorrectly set the slashes property to true
  • 81ab967 [fix] Ignore slashes after the protocol for special URLs
  • ee22050 [ci] Use GitHub Actions
  • d2979b5 [fix] Special case the file: protocol (#204)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=url-parse&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.5.1&new-version=1.5.3)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/network/alerts).

Issues.Title: Improve documents and examples for composition api store
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Currently, the document describe how to use composition api of vuex useStore is very limited.
None of the example show how to use useStore in .vue flies setup function and in js/ts files. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
To the very least, the examples must include useStore() examples, how to import and use them in .vue setup function and in .js/ts files

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Improve documents and examples for composition api store" (#2065)

Issues.Title: [DEP0148] DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package
Issues.Body:
Hello,

I would like to report a small warning during the build phase, which can easily be removed.

### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
no need for a link in this case
[localhost/](http://localhost?msg=no need for a link in this case)

### Steps to reproduce
Node / Electron Build process

### What is expected?
Build without warnings
, just change this in the "package.json" file :
```
  "exports": {
    ".": {
      "module": "./dist/vuex.esm-bundler.js",
      "require": "./dist/vuex.cjs.js",
      "import": "./dist/vuex.mjs"
    },
    "./": "./"  <----------------------- by "./*": "./*"
  },
```

### What is actually happening?
 [DEP0148] DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at package.json

Update this package.json to use a subpath pattern like "./*".

---
Thanks in advance.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " [DEP0148] DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package" (#2064)
